TEXT: The applicants are NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE . She is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , may be summarised as follows .
A.

The applicant commenced a long - term relationship with PERSON in DATE . The couple never married but lived together until PERSON died , in DATE , aged DATE , from an accident at work . The couple had CARDINAL children , PERSON born on DATE , PERSON born on DATE and PERSON born on CARDINAL DATE .

PERSON worked as a self - employed builder and paid full social security and national insurance contributions as a self - employed earner . His contribution record was such that had he been married to the applicant , she would have been entitled to social security benefits as his widow on his death .

On DATE the applicant submitted a claim for widow ’s benefits ( widow ’s payment and widowed mother ’s allowance ) to ORG . Her claim was rejected on DATE on the basis that widow ’s benefits could only be paid where the claimant had been married to the person who had died . The applicant appealed the decision on DATE , arguing a breach of LAW of LAW ( “ the Convention ” ) . ORG rejected her appeal , stating that an individual could not rely on the LAW in domestic courts . The applicant was granted leave to appeal to a ORG Commissioner on DATE . On DATE Commissioner PERSON dismissed her appeal , stating that she had no remedy under domestic law or the Convention in a domestic court . The applicant applied for leave to appeal to ORG on DATE and was refused leave on DATE .

The applicant is currently working full - time . She receives child benefit for her CARDINAL children amounting to ORG DATE . She receives no other social security benefits although she did receive a lump sum pension from a private insurance policy taken out by PERSON during his life . If the applicant were entitled to receive social security benefits equivalent to those to which a married woman in similar circumstances to herself would be entitled , she would be GBP CARDINAL per week better off . She would also have received a CARDINAL - off Widow ’s Payment of GBP CARDINAL .
B. Relevant domestic law

Under GPE law , certain social security benefits , including ORG , Widowed Mother ’s Allowance , and ORG , are paid for out of ORG . By LAW , the funds required for paying such benefits are to be provided by means of contributions payable to the Secretary of ORG by earners , employers and others , together with certain additions made to the ORG by ORG . It makes no difference to the contributions payable whether someone is single or married .
CARDINAL . Widow ’s Payment
Under LAW of the DATE Act , a woman who has been widowed is entitled to a widow ’s payment ( currently a lump sum payment of GBP CARDINAL ) if :
she is under pensionable age at the time when her husband died , or he was not then entitled to a Category A retirement pension ;
( ii ) her husband satisfied certain specified social security contribution conditions set out in a Schedule to the DATE Act . of LAW No . CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . Widowed Mother ’s ORG

Under LAW of the DATE Act , in so far as relevant , a woman who has been widowed ( and who has not remarried ) is entitled to a mother ’s allowance on certain conditions , the following being the relevant conditions to the circumstance of the present case :
( i ) her husband satisfied the contribution conditions set out in a Schedule to the LAW ; and
( ii ) she is entitled to receive child benefit in relation to a son or daughter of herself and her late husband .
The Widowed Mother ’s ORG currently amounts to GBP CARDINAL per week , with an extra GBP DATE in respect of the eldest eligible child , and a further GBP DATE in respect of other children .
CARDINAL . Widow ’s Pension
Under LAW of the DATE Act , a woman who has been widowed ( and who is not remarried ) is entitled to a widow ’s pension if :
( i ) her husband satisfied the contribution conditions set out in a Schedule to the LAW ; and
( ii ) at the date of her husband ’s death she was over DATE but under DATE ; or
( iii ) she ceased to be entitled to a widowed mother ’s allowance at the time when she was over DATE but under DATE .
If the applicant had been married to PERSON , she could look forward to entitlement to a Widow ’s Pension in the future , when she would no longer be entitled to the Widowed Mother ’s Allowance .
